structured.description: A 3D camera class called `Camera3D`. It includes various methods for calculating the camera's projection and view matrices based on user input and other factors such as aspect ratio and field of view. The code also includes a `processInput()` method that handles keyboard and mouse inputs, allowing the camera to move and rotate in response.

items.description: Is an extension of the Camera class with additional functionality to handle 3D camera inputs. It has a constructor that takes fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar parameters to calculate the projection matrix, and an adjustToViewport method to set the viewport size. The processInput method processes keyboard and mouse input to rotate and move the camera.
items.name: Camera3D

items.description: Calculates a matrix that represents the projection of a 3D scene onto a 2D image plane, based on provided camera data.

params.name: data
params.description: 3D camera parameters for which the projection matrix should be calculated.

returns.description: a Matrix4f object containing the camera's projection matrix.

items.name: calculateProjectionMatrix

items.description: Adjusts the camera's projection and view matrices to fit within the viewport specified by the user. It also sets the viewport size and positions the camera at the origin.

params.name: width
params.description: 2D viewport width for which the projection and view matrices are calculated and then set as the GL_VIEWPORT value.

params.name: height
params.description: 2D viewport size, which is used to calculate the appropriate projection and view matrices for the 3D scene.

usage.description: In this example, we create an instance of the Camera3D class and use its adjustToViewport method to adjust the viewport to have a width of 800 and height of 600.

items.name: adjustToViewport

items.description: Is a custom implementation of the Camera Struct for a 3D environment. It contains four instance fields: fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar, which are used to calculate the perspective projection matrix in the calculateProjectionMatrix method. The class also includes a getAsMatrix4 method that returns the perspective projection matrix as a Matrix4f object.
items.name: CameraStruct3D

items.description: Initializes a matrix representing a perspective projection with field of view (fov), aspect ratio, near and far distances.

returns.description: a matrix representation of a perspective projection, initialized with the specified field of view, aspect ratio, near and far distances.

usage.code:
Camera3D camera = new Camera3D(70, 16 / 9, 0.1f, 100);
Matrix4f projectionMatrix = camera.getAsMatrix4();

items.name: getAsMatrix4

items.description: Processes mouse input and keyboard input to move a 3D object based on user inputs.

params.name: dt
params.description: time step of the animation, which determines the amount of movement the object undergoes during each frame.

params.name: speed
params.description: 3D movement speed of the object being controlled by the code, and it is multiplied by the time elapsed (represented by `dt`) to determine the total distance traveled during the frame.

params.name: sens
params.description: sensitivity of the mouse input, which determines how much the character will move based on the distance of the mouse cursor from the center of the screen.

items.name: processInput

items.description: Moves an entity by a specified amount along a given direction, using the transform's `setPos()` method.

params.name: dir
params.description: 3D direction in which the object should be moved, with the movement amount being applied to its position.

params.name: amt
params.description: amount of movement along the specified direction, which is added to the current position of the transform.

items.name: move

structured.description: An abstract Camera class that handles camera transformations and projections in a 3D graphics system. The camera is initialized with a projection matrix and can be adjusted to fit a viewport. It uses the math package to perform rotations and translations on the view matrix, which is then combined with the projection matrix to produce the final view-projection matrix.

items.description: Is an abstract class that represents a camera in a 3D environment. It provides methods for calculating matrices related to the camera's position and orientation, such as view projection and translation. The class also defines an interface for calculating a projection matrix and adjusting the camera to a specific viewport size.
items.name: Camera

items.description: Calculates a combined view and projection matrix if necessary, based on a specified transformation and returns it. The calculation is performed only when the previous result is null or the transformation has changed.

returns.description: a Matrix4f representing the combined view and projection transformation.

items.name: getViewProjection

items.description: Calculates a view matrix by multiplying the camera's rotation and translation matrices with the projection matrix, resulting in a transformed matrix that defines the camera's viewpoint. The output is then assigned to the `viewProjectionMat4`.

returns.description: a transformed Matrix4f representing the view of a camera.

items.name: calculateViewMatrix

items.description: Computes a translation matrix from a given position vector. It multiplies the current transformed position by -1 to invert it, then initializes a new Matrix4f object with the resulting x, y, and z values as the translation parameters.

returns.description: a 4x4 translation matrix representing the inverse of the camera position.

items.name: getTranslationMatrix

items.description: Returns the current value of the `transform` variable. It provides read-only access to the transformation data without modifying it. The returned object is a snapshot of the current state of the transformation.

usage.code:
Camera camera = new Camera(new Matrix4f());
Transform transform = camera.getTransform();
usage.description: The provided code snippet creates a new instance of the Camera class with a given projection matrix, then retrieves its transform object using the getTransform method.

items.name: getTransform

items.description: Is an abstract class that serves as a base for other camera-related data structures. It defines an abstract method getAsMatrix4() that returns a Matrix4f object. This suggests that the CameraStruct class is used to encapsulate various types of camera-specific data that can be converted into a matrix representation.
items.name: CameraStruct
